bibl.title: Letter from Ernest Lundeen to Philip Showalter Hench, August 22, 1940

div1.p: Lundeen acknowledges Hench's letter and promises careful consideration with reference to adding Lambert's name to the Yellow Fever Roll of Honor.

div1.head: Letter from Ernest Lundeen to Philip Showalter Hench, August 22, 1940
div1.opener:

CHAN GURNEY, S. DAK.

W. I. SMALLEY, ASST. CLERK
United States Senate
COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS
August 22, 1940
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have your communication of August 16th
before me and note your complaint with reference to
adding the name of Gustave E. Lambert, formerly of
the Army Hospital Corps, to the Yellow Fever Roll of
Honor.

This matter will be given my careful and
studied consideration.

With my best wishes and kindest personal
regards, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, ERNEST LUNDEEN EL:KR
